c:simple-property.name: startScript
c:simple-property.c:description: The path to the script that the Start and Restart operations should use to start the server. If the path is not absolute, it is resolved relative to the server home directory (e.g. "bin/standalone.sh", "bin/domain.sh").

c:simple-property.name: startScriptPrefix
c:simple-property.c:description: A prefix command line that should be prepended to the start script command line by the Start and Restart operations; the prefix command must be an absolute path (e.g. "/usr/bin/sudo"). This property is most commonly used to run the AS7 process as a different user than the RHQ Agent (e.g. "sudo -u jboss -g jboss" could be used to run AS7 as user "jboss" and group "jboss". It is also possible to chain prefix commands (e.g. "nohup sudo -u jboss" could be used to make AS7 ignore HUP signals and to run as user "jboss").

c:simple-property.name: startScriptEnv
c:simple-property.c:description: The variables that the Start and Restart operations will add to the environment of the server start script. Each name=value pair should be on a new line. Variable values should *not* be enclosed in quotes (e.g. JAVA_OPTS=-Xms512M -Xmx1024M). On UNIX systems, the typical minimum set of environment variables is: PATH=/usr/bin:/bin . And on Windows the typical minimum set is: PATH=C:\Windows\System32;C:\Windows , OS=Windows_NT , SYSTEMROOT=C:\Windows . In addition, it is good practice to set JAVA_HOME to the absolute path of the install directory of the JRE or JDK you wish to use to run the AS7 instance. However, if JAVA_HOME is not specified, the start script will attempt to find java in the PATH. There is currently a 2000 character limit for this value.

c:simple-property.name: startScriptArgs
c:simple-property.c:description: The arguments that the Start and Restart operations will pass to the server start script. Each argument should be on a new line - for example: --server-config=standalone-ha-full.xml. As an exception, the value of a space-delimited option can optionally be on the same line as the option - for example: -c standalone-ha-full.xml. There is currently a 2000 character limit for this value.

c:simple-property.name: logFilePath
c:simple-property.description: The absolute path to the source log file.

c:simple-property.name: enabled
c:simple-property.description: A flag indicating whether of not this log Event source is currently enabled (i.e. whether the associated log file should be tailed for new entries).

c:simple-property.name: dateFormat
c:simple-property.description: The date format to use when parsing the dates in log entries. The format must be in the syntax defined by the Java SimpleDateFormat class. If not specified, the three date formats that are predefined by Log4J (ISO8601, DATE, and ABSOLUTE) will be tried.

c:simple-property.name: includesPattern
c:simple-property.description: A regular expression against which the details of a log entry is matched to determine if an Event should be fired for that entry. If not specified, no filtering of log entries will be done based on their detail.

c:simple-property.name: minimumSeverity
c:simple-property.description: The minimum severity of Events that should be collected for this source. If not specified, there is no minimum severity (i.e. all events will be collected).

c:simple-property.name: capacity
c:simple-property.description: Capacity of the metric.

c:simple-property.name: class
c:simple-property.description: Class name of the custom metric.

c:simple-property.name: weight
c:simple-property.description: Weight of the metric.

c:simple-property.name: operationResult
c:simple-property.description: Add new custom metric to the load balancer provider.

c:simple-property.name: proxy-list
c:simple-property.description: List of proxies, Format (hostname:port) separated with commas.

c:simple-property.name: proxy-url
c:simple-property.description: Base URL for MCMP requests.

c:simple-property.name: advertise-socket
c:simple-property.description: Name of Socket binding to use for the Advertise socket.

c:simple-property.name: advertise
c:simple-property.description: Use Advertise logic or not.

c:simple-property.name: advertise-security-key
c:simple-property.description: String containing the security key for the Advertise logic.

c:simple-property.name: balancer
c:simple-property.description: The balancer name.

c:simple-property.name: connector
c:simple-property.description: Name of the web connector used to communicate with the load balancer.

c:simple-property.name: load-balancing-group
c:simple-property.description: loadBalancingGroup name.

c:simple-property.name: excluded-contexts
c:simple-property.description: List of contexts mod_cluster should ignore, Format String separated with commas.

c:simple-property.name: auto-enable-contexts
c:simple-property.description: Enable contexts even if disabled in mod_cluster_manger (httpd).

c:simple-property.name: sticky-session
c:simple-property.description: Use sticky sessions for requests.

c:simple-property.name: sticky-session-remove
c:simple-property.description: Remove session information on failover.

c:simple-property.name: sticky-session-force
c:simple-property.description: Don't failover a request with session information.

c:simple-property.name: worker-timeout
c:simple-property.description: Timeout to wait in httpd for an available worker to process the requests.

c:simple-property.name: max-attempts
c:simple-property.description: Max attempts to process an idempotent request.

c:simple-property.name: flush-packets
c:simple-property.description: Enables/disables packet flushing in httpd.

c:simple-property.name: flush-wait
c:simple-property.description: Time to wait before flushing packets in httpd.

c:simple-property.name: ping
c:simple-property.description: Time (in seconds) in which to wait for a pong answer to a ping.

c:simple-property.name: smax
c:simple-property.description: Soft maximum idle connection count in httpd

c:simple-property.name: ttl
c:simple-property.description: Time to live (in seconds) for idle connections above smax

c:simple-property.name: node-timeout
c:simple-property.description: Timeout (in seconds) for proxy connections to a node.

c:simple-property.name: stop-context-timeout
c:simple-property.description: Max time to wait for context to process pending requests.

c:simple-property.name: socket-timeout
c:simple-property.description: Timeout to wait for httpd to answer a MCMP message.

c:simple-property.name: agent-path
c:simple-property.description: The JVM agent path.

c:simple-property.name: env-classpath-ignored
c:simple-property.description: Ignore the environment classpath.

c:list-property.name: environment-variables
c:list-property.description: The JVM environment variables.

c:simple-property.name: heap-size
c:simple-property.description: The initial heap size allocated by the JVM.

c:simple-property.name: java-agent
c:simple-property.description: The java agent.

c:simple-property.name: java-home
c:simple-property.description: The java home

c:list-property.name: jvm-options
c:list-property.description: The JVM options. Those can not be changed after initial creation of the definition.

c:simple-property.name: max-heap-size
c:simple-property.description: The maximum heap size that can be allocated by the JVM.

c:simple-property.name: max-permgen-size
c:simple-property.description: The maximum size of the permanent generation.

c:simple-property.name: permgen-size
c:simple-property.description: The initial permanent generation size.

c:simple-property.name: stack-size
c:simple-property.description: The JVM stack size settings.

c:simple-property.name: type
c:simple-property.description: The JVM type can be either SUN or IBM

c:simple-property.name: path
c:simple-property.description: The filesystem path.

c:simple-property.name: relative-to
c:simple-property.description:
The name of another previously named path, or of one of the standard paths provided by the system. If 'relative-to' is provided, the value of the 'path' attribute is treated as relative to the path specified by this attribute. The standard paths provided by the system include:
  • jboss.home - the root directory of the JBoss AS distribution
  • user.home - user's home directory
  • user.dir - user's current working directory
  • java.home - java installation directory
  • jboss.server.base.dir - root directory for an individual server instance
  • jboss.server.data.dir - directory the server will use for persistent data file storage
  • jboss.server.log.dir - directory the server will use for log file storage
  • jboss.server.tmp.dir - directory the server will use for temporary file storage
  • jboss.domain.servers.dir - directory under which a host controller will create the working area for individual server instances

The number of statements discarded from the cache
The number of times that statements from the cache were used
The active count
The available count
The average time spent blocking for a connection
The average time spent creating a physical connection
The created count
The destroyed count
The maximum time for creating a physical connection
The maximum number of connections used
The maximum wait time for a connection
The timed out count
The total time spent creating physical connections
The total blocking time
The min pool size setting
The max pool size setting

operation.name: disable
operation.description: Disables the data-source

operation.name: flush-idle-connection-in-pool
operation.description: Flushes the pool for idle connections

operation.name: test-connection-in-pool
operation.description: Tests if a connection can be obtained

c:simple-property.name: connection-url
c:simple-property.description: The JDBC driver connection URL

c:simple-property.name: driver-name
c:simple-property.description: Name of the (existing) JDBC driver to use

c:simple-property.name: driver-class
c:simple-property.description: The fully qualified name of the JDBC driver class

c:simple-property.name: jndi-name
c:simple-property.description: Specifies the JNDI name for the datasource

c:simple-property.name: driver
c:simple-property.description: Defines the JDBC driver the datasource should use with this format: driver-name>#major-version.minor-version where driver-name is the fully qualified name of the JDBC driver class

c:simple-property.name: user-name
c:simple-property.description: Specify the username used when creating a new connection.

c:simple-property.name: password
c:simple-property.description: Specify the password used when creating a new connection.

c:simple-property.name: new-connection-sql
c:simple-property.description: Specifies an SQL statement to execute whenever a connection is added to the connection pool.

c:simple-property.name: url-delimiter
c:simple-property.description: Specifies the delimiter for URLs in connection-url for HA datasources

c:simple-property.name: url-selector-strategy-class-name
c:simple-property.description: A class that implements org.jboss.jca.adapters.jdbc.URLSelectorStrategy

c:simple-property.name: use-java-context
c:simple-property.description: Setting this to false will bind the DataSource into global JNDI;

c:simple-property.name: enabled
c:simple-property.description: Specifies if the datasource should be enabled

c:simple-property.name: jta
c:simple-property.description: Enable JTA integration

c:simple-property.name: max-pool-size
c:simple-property.description: The max-pool-size element indicates the maximum number of connections for a pool. No more connections will be created in each sub-pool.

c:simple-property.name: min-pool-size
c:simple-property.description: The min-pool-size element indicates the minimum number of connections a pool should hold. These are not created until a Subject is known from a request for a connection.

c:simple-property.name: pool-prefill
c:simple-property.description: Whether to attempt to prefill the connection pool. Changing this value require a server restart.

c:simple-property.name: pool-use-strict-min
c:simple-property.description: Define if the min-pool-size should be considered a strictly.

c:simple-property.name: security-domain
c:simple-property.description: Indicates Subject (from security domain) are used to distinguish connections in the pool. The content of the security-domain is the name of the JAAS security manager that will handleauthentication. This name correlates to the JAAS login-config.xml descriptor application-policy/name attribute.

c:simple-property.name: reauth-plugin-class-name
c:simple-property.description: re-authentication plugin implementation provided for specific purpose (i.e vendor)

c:simple-property.name: flush-strategy
c:simple-property.description: Specifies how the pool should be flush in case of an error.

c:simple-property.name: allow-multiple-users
c:simple-property.description: Specifies if multiple users will access the datasource through the getConnection(user, password) method and hence if the internal pool type should account for that

c:simple-property.name: prepared-statements-cache-size
c:simple-property.description: The number of prepared statements per connection in an LRU cache

c:simple-property.name: share-prepared-statements
c:simple-property.description: Whether to share prepare statements, i.e. whether asking for same statement twice without closing uses the same underlying prepared statement

c:simple-property.name: track-statements
c:simple-property.description: Whether to check for unclosed statements when a connection is returned to the pool and result sets are closed when a statement is closed/return to the prepared statement cache. valid values are: false - do not track statements and results true - track statements and result sets and warn when they are not closed nowarn - track statements but do no warn about them being unclosed

c:simple-property.name: allocation-retry
c:simple-property.description: The allocation retry element indicates the number of times that allocating a connection should be tried before throwing an exception.

c:simple-property.name: allocation-retry-wait-millis
c:simple-property.description: Indicates the time in milliseconds to wait between retrying to allocate a connection.

c:simple-property.name: blocking-timeout-wait-millis
c:simple-property.description: The blocking-timeout-millis element indicates the maximum time in milliseconds to block while waiting for a connection before throwing an exception. Note that this blocks only while waiting for a permit for a connection, and will never throw an exception if creating a new connection takes an inordinately long time.

c:simple-property.name: idle-timeout-minutes
c:simple-property.description: The idle-timeout-minutes elements indicates the maximum time in minutes a connection may be idle before being closed. The actual maximum time depends also on the IdleRemover scan time, which is 1/2 the smallest idle-timeout-minutes of any pool. Changing this value require a server restart.

c:simple-property.name: query-timeout
c:simple-property.description: Any configured query timeout in seconds The default is no timeout

c:simple-property.name: use-try-lock
c:simple-property.description: Any configured timeout for internal locks on the resource adapter objects in seconds

c:simple-property.name: set-tx-query-timeout
c:simple-property.description: Whether to set the query timeout based on the time remaining until transaction timeout, any configured query timeout will be used if there is no transaction.

c:simple-property.name: transaction-isolation
c:simple-property.description: Set java.sql.Connection transaction isolation level to use. The constants defined by transaction-isolation-values are the possible transaction isolation levels.

c:simple-property.name: check-valid-connection-sql
c:simple-property.description: Specify an SQL statement to check validity of a pool connection. This may be called when managed connection is taken from pool for use.

c:simple-property.name: exception-sorter-class-name
c:simple-property.description: An org.jboss.jca.adapters.jdbc.ExceptionSorter that provides a boolean isExceptionFatal(SQLException e) method to validate is an exception should be broadcast to all javax.resource.spi.ConnectionEventListener as a connectionErrorOccurred

c:simple-property.name: stale-connection-checker-class-name
c:simple-property.description: An org.jboss.jca.adapters.jdbc.StaleConnectionChecker that provides a boolean isStaleConnection(SQLException e) method which if it it returns true will wrap the exception in an org.jboss.jca.adapters.jdbc.StaleConnectionException

c:simple-property.name: valid-connection-checker-class-name
c:simple-property.description: An org.jboss.jca.adapters.jdbc.ValidConnectionChecker that provides a SQLException isValidConnection(Connection e) method to validate is a connection is valid. An exception means the connection is destroyed. This overrides the check-valid-connection-sql when present.

c:simple-property.name: background-validation-millis
c:simple-property.description: The background-validation-millis element specifies the amount of time, in milliseconds, that background validation will run. Changing this value require a server restart.

c:simple-property.name: background-validation
c:simple-property.description: An element to specify that connections should be validated on a background thread versus being validated prior to use. Changing this value require a server restart.

c:simple-property.name: use-fast-fail
c:simple-property.description: Whether fail a connection allocation on the first connection if it is invalid (true) or keep trying until the pool is exhausted of all potential connections (false)

c:simple-property.name: validate-on-match
c:simple-property.description: The validate-on-match element indicates whether or not connection level validation should be done when a connection factory attempts to match a managed connection for a given set. This is typically exclusive to the use of background validation

c:simple-property.name: spy
c:simple-property.description: whatever spy or not the jdbc connection

c:simple-property.name: use-ccm
c:simple-property.description: Enable the use of a cached connection manager

c:simple-property.name: connection-url
c:simple-property.description: The JDBC driver connection URL

c:simple-property.name: driver-name
c:simple-property.description: Name of the (existing) JDBC driver to use

c:simple-property.description: The fully qualified name of the JDBC driver class

c:simple-property.description: Oracle does not like XA connections getting used both inside and outside a JTA transaction. To workaround the problem you can create separate sub-pools for the different context

c:simple-property.name: pad-xid
c:simple-property.description: Should the Xid be padded

c:simple-property.name: same-rm-override
c:simple-property.description: The is-same-rm-override element allows one to unconditionally set whether the javax.transaction.xa.XAResource.isSameRM(XAResource) returns true or false

c:simple-property.name: wrap-xa-datasource
c:simple-property.description: Should the XAResource instances be wrapped in a org.jboss.tm.XAResourceWrapper instance

c:simple-property.name: security-domain
c:simple-property.description: Indicates Subject (from security domain) are used to distinguish connections in the pool. The content of the security-domain is the name of the JAAS security manager that will handleauthentication. This name correlates to the JAAS login-config.xml descriptor application-policy/name attribute.

c:simple-property.name: recovery-plugin-class-name
c:simple-property.description: recovery plugin implementation provided for specific purpose (i.e vendor)

c:simple-property.name: reauth-plugin-class-name
c:simple-property.description: re-authentication plugin implementation provided for specific purpose (i.e vendor)

c:simple-property.name: flush-strategy
c:simple-property.description: Specifies how the pool should be flush in case of an error.

c:simple-property.name: prepared-statements-cache-size
c:simple-property.description: The number of prepared statements per connection in an LRU cache

c:simple-property.name: share-prepared-statements
c:simple-property.description: Whether to share prepare statements, i.e. whether asking for same statement twice without closing uses the same underlying prepared statement

c:simple-property.name: track-statements
c:simple-property.description: Whether to check for unclosed statements when a connection is returned to the pool and result sets are closed when a statement is closed/return to the prepared statement cache. valid values are: false - do not track statements and results true - track statements and result sets and warn when they are not closed nowarn - track statements but do no warn about them being unclosed

c:simple-property.name: allocation-retry
c:simple-property.description: The allocation retry element indicates the number of times that allocating a connection should be tried before throwing an exception.

c:simple-property.name: allocation-retry-wait-millis
c:simple-property.description: he allocation retry wait millis element indicates the time in milliseconds to wait between retrying to allocate a connection.

c:simple-property.name: blocking-timeout-wait-millis
c:simple-property.description: The blocking-timeout-millis element indicates the maximum time in milliseconds to block while waiting for a connection before throwing an exception. Note that this blocks only while waiting for a permit for a connection, and will never throw an exception if creating a new connection takes an inordinately long time.

c:simple-property.name: idle-timeout-minutes
c:simple-property.description: The idle-timeout-minutes elements indicates the maximum time in minutes a connection may be idle before being closed. The actual maximum time depends also on the IdleRemover scan time, which is 1/2 the smallest idle-timeout-minutes of any pool. Changing this value require a server restart.

c:simple-property.name: query-timeout
c:simple-property.description: Any configured query timeout in seconds The default is no timeout

c:simple-property.name: use-try-lock
c:simple-property.description: Any configured timeout for internal locks on the resource adapter objects in seconds

c:simple-property.name: set-tx-query-timeout
c:simple-property.description: Whether to set the query timeout based on the time remaining until transaction timeout, any configured query timeout will be used if there is no transaction.

c:simple-property.name: transaction-isolation
c:simple-property.description: Set java.sql.Connection transaction isolation level to use. The constants defined by transaction-isolation-values are the possible transaction isolation levels.

c:simple-property.name: check-valid-connection-sql
c:simple-property.description: Specify an SQL statement to check validity of a pool connection. This may be called when managed connection is taken from pool for use.

c:simple-property.name: exception-sorter-class-name
c:simple-property.description: An org.jboss.jca.adapters.jdbc.ExceptionSorter that provides a boolean isExceptionFatal(SQLException e) method to validate is an exception should be broadcast to all javax.resource.spi.ConnectionEventListener as a connectionErrorOccurred

c:simple-property.name: stale-connection-checker-class-name
c:simple-property.description: An org.jboss.jca.adapters.jdbc.StaleConnectionChecker that provides a boolean isStaleConnection(SQLException e) method which if it it returns true will wrap the exception in an org.jboss.jca.adapters.jdbc.StaleConnectionException

c:simple-property.name: valid-connection-checker-class-name
c:simple-property.description: An org.jboss.jca.adapters.jdbc.ValidConnectionChecker that provides a SQLException isValidConnection(Connection e) method to validate is a connection is valid. An exception means the connection is destroyed. This overrides the check-valid-connection-sql when present.

c:simple-property.name: background-validation-millis
c:simple-property.description: The background-validation-millis element specifies the amount of time, in milliseconds, that background validation will run. Changing this value require a server restart.

c:simple-property.name: background-validation
c:simple-property.description: An element to specify that connections should be validated on a background thread versus being validated prior to use. Changing this value require a server restart.

c:simple-property.name: use-fast-fail
c:simple-property.description: Whether fail a connection allocation on the first connection if it is invalid (true) or keep trying until the pool is exhausted of all potential connections (false)

c:simple-property.name: validate-on-match
c:simple-property.description: The validate-on-match element indicates whether or not connection level validation should be done when a connection factory attempts to match a managed connection for a given set. This is typically exclusive to the use of background validation

c:simple-property.name: xa-resource-timeout
c:simple-property.description: Passed to XAResource.setTransactionTimeout() Default is zero which does not invoke the setter. In seconds

c:simple-property.name: spy
c:simple-property.description: whatever spy or not the jdbc connection

c:simple-property.name: use-ccm
c:simple-property.description: Enable the use of a cached connection manager

c:simple-property.name: recovery-username
c:simple-property.description: username used to try connection recovery

c:simple-property.name: recovery-password
c:simple-property.description: password used to try connection recovery

c:simple-property.name: recovery-security-domain
c:simple-property.description: security-domain used to try connection recovery

c:simple-property.name: no-recovery
c:simple-property.description: if true no recovery are tried for this connection pool

c:simple-property.name: xa-datasource-class
c:simple-property.description: The fully qualified name of the javax.sql.XADataSource implementation

c:simple-property.name: jndi-name
c:simple-property.description: Specifies the JNDI name for the datasource

c:simple-property.name: driver-name
c:simple-property.description: Defines the JDBC driver the datasource should use. It is a symbolic name matching the the name of installed driver. In case the driver is deployed as jar, the name is the name of deployment unit

c:simple-property.name: user-name
c:simple-property.description: Specify the username used when creating a new connection.

c:simple-property.name: password
c:simple-property.description: Specify the password used when creating a new connection.

c:simple-property.name: new-connection-sql
c:simple-property.description: Specifies an SQL statement to execute whenever a connection is added to the connection pool.

c:simple-property.name: url-delimiter
c:simple-property.description: Specifies the delimiter for URLs in connection-url for HA datasources

c:simple-property.name: url-selector-strategy-class-name
c:simple-property.description: A class that implements org.jboss.jca.adapters.jdbc.URLSelectorStrategy

c:simple-property.name: use-java-context
c:simple-property.description: Setting this to false will bind the DataSource into global JNDI;

c:simple-property.name: enabled
c:simple-property.description: Specifies if the datasource should be enabled

c:simple-property.name: max-pool-size
c:simple-property.description: The max-pool-size element indicates the maximum number of connections for a pool. No more connections will be created in each sub-pool.

c:simple-property.name: min-pool-size
c:simple-property.description: The min-pool-size element indicates the minimum number of connections a pool should hold. These are not created until a Subject is known from a request for a connection.

c:simple-property.name: pool-prefill
c:simple-property.description: Whether to attempt to prefill the connection pool. Changing this value require a server restart.

c:simple-property.name: pool-use-strict-min
c:simple-property.description: Define if the min-pool-size should be considered a strictly.

c:simple-property.name: interleaving

plugin.name: &pluginName;
plugin.description: provides monitoring and management of JBossAS 7.x and JBoss EAP/JDG 6.x
plugin.server:
&startScriptPluginConfigGroup; &logSources; &availabilityCheckPeriod; &serverKindMetrics; pluginConfiguration homeDir The server can be started, restarted, or stopped via the Start, Restart, and Shutdown operations. The Start and Restart operations start the server by executing the server start script, typically domain.sh on UNIX or domain.bat on Windows. The following connection settings can be used to configure the start script execution:
  • Start Script - the absolute path of the start script (e.g. "/opt/jboss-as-7.1.1.Final/bin/domain.sh")
  • Start Script Prefix - a prefix command line to be prepended to the start script command line (e.g. "nohup sudo -u jboss -g jboss")
  • Start Script Arguments - arguments to be passed to the start script (e.g. "--host-config=host-master.xml")
  • Start Script Environment - environment variables to be set in the start script's environment (e.g. "JAVA_HOME=/usr/java/jdk1.6.0_30")
These settings are automatically initialized by the JBossAS7 plugin discovery code to match the currently running server process' command line and environment.

The settings are not used by the Stop operation, since it stops the server via the management interface, not via a script.

For more detailed descriptions of the settings, see the Connection Settings section below.

&startScriptPluginConfigGroup; &logSources; &availabilityCheckPeriod; &serverKindMetrics; pluginConfiguration homeDir measurementTrait deployDir pluginConfiguration homeDir pluginConfiguration baseDir measurementTrait deployDir The server can be started, restarted, or stopped via the Start, Restart, and Shutdown operations. The Start and Restart operations start the server by executing the server start script, typically standalone.sh on UNIX or standalone.bat on Windows. The following connection settings can be used to configure the start script execution:
  • Start Script - the absolute path of the start script (e.g. "/opt/jboss-as-7.1.1.Final/bin/standalone.sh")
  • Start Script Prefix - a prefix command line to be prepended to the start script command line (e.g. "nohup sudo -u jboss -g jboss")
  • Start Script Arguments - arguments to be passed to the start script (e.g. "--server-config=standalone-full-ha.xml")
  • Start Script Environment - environment variables to be set in the start script's environment (e.g. "JAVA_HOME=/usr/java/jdk1.6.0_30")
These settings are automatically initialized by the JBossAS7 plugin discovery code to match the currently running server process' command line and environment.

The settings are not used by the Stop operation, since it stops the server via the management interface, not via a script.

For more detailed descriptions of the settings, see the Connection Settings section below. &modclusterSharedOpsConfig;

service.name: Profile
service.description: A profile in a domain. Profiles are assigned to server groups.

service.name: ModCluster Domain Service
service.description: Mod_cluster support

service.name: Binding (Profile)
service.description: JNDI bindings for primitive types

c:simple-property.name: binding-type
c:simple-property.description: The type of binding to create, may be simple, lookup or object-factory

c:simple-property.name: class
c:simple-property.description: The object factory class name for object factory bindings

c:simple-property.name: lookup
c:simple-property.description: The entry to lookup in JNDI for lookup bindings

c:simple-property.name: module
c:simple-property.description: The module to load the object factory from for object factory bindings

c:simple-property.name: type
c:simple-property.description: The type of the value to bind for simple bindings, this must be a primitive type

c:simple-property.name: value
c:simple-property.description: The value to bind for simple bindings

c:simple-property.name: default-virtual-server
c:simple-property.description: The web container's default virtual server. The default value is default-host.

c:simple-property.name: instance-id
c:simple-property.description: The identifier for this server instance.

c:simple-property.name: native
c:simple-property.description: Add the native initialization listener to the web container. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: disabled:0
c:simple-property.description: Enable the default Servlet mapping. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: file-encoding
c:simple-property.description: Force a file encoding.

c:simple-property.name: listings
c:simple-property.description: Enable folder listings. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: max-depth
c:simple-property.description: Maximum recursion for PROPFIND. The default value is 3.

c:simple-property.name: read-only
c:simple-property.description: Allow write HTTP methods (PUT, DELETE). The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: sendfile
c:simple-property.description: Enable sendfile if possible, for files bigger than the specified byte size. The default value is 49152.

c:simple-property.name: secret
c:simple-property.description: Secret for WebDAV locking operations.

c:simple-property.name: webdav
c:simple-property.description: Enable WebDAV functionality. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: check-interval
c:simple-property.description: Check interval for JSP updates using a background thread. The default value is 0.

c:simple-property.name: development
c:simple-property.description: Enable the development mode, which gives more information when an error occurs. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: disabled:1
c:simple-property.description: Enable the JSP container. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: display-source-fragment
c:simple-property.description: When a runtime error occurs, attempts to display corresponding JSP source fragment. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: dump-smap
c:simple-property.description: Write SMAP data to a file. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: error-on-use-bean-invalid-class-attribute
c:simple-property.description: Enable errors when using a bad class in useBean. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: generate-strings-as-char-arrays
c:simple-property.description: Generate String constants as char arrays. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: java-encoding
c:simple-property.description: Specify the encoding used for Java sources. The default value is UTF8.

c:simple-property.name: keep-generated
c:simple-property.description: Keep the generated Servlets. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: mapped-file
c:simple-property.description: Map to the JSP source. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: modification-test-interval
c:simple-property.description: Minimum amount of time between two tests for updates, in seconds. The default value is 4.

c:simple-property.name: recompile-on-fail
c:simple-property.description: Retry failed JSP compilations on each request. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: scratch-dir
c:simple-property.description: Specify a different work directory.

c:simple-property.name: smap
c:simple-property.description: Enable SMAP. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: source-vm
c:simple-property.description: Source VM level for compilation. The default value is 1.5.

c:simple-property.name: tag-pooling
c:simple-property.description: Enable tag pooling. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: target-vm
c:simple-property.description: Target VM level for compilation. The default value is 1.5.

c:simple-property.name: trim-spaces
c:simple-property.description: Trim some spaces from the generated Servlet. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: x-powered-by
c:simple-property.description: Enable advertising the JSP engine in x-powered-by. The default value is true.

c:list-property.name: welcome-file
c:list-property.description: A welcome file declaration.

c:simple-property.name: scheme
c:simple-property.description: The web connector scheme.

c:simple-property.name: socket-binding
c:simple-property.description: The web connector socket-binding reference, this connector should be bound to.

c:simple-property.name: enabled
c:simple-property.description: Defines whether the connector should be started on startup. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: enable-lookups
c:simple-property.description: Enable DNS lookups for Servlet API. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: executor
c:simple-property.description: The name of the executor that should be used for the processing threads of this connector. If undefined defaults to using an internal pool.

c:simple-property.name: max-connections:expr
c:simple-property.description: Amount of concurrent connections that can be processed by the connector with optimum performance. The default value depends on the connector used and the number of cpu cores (512*cores for HTTP, 32*cores for AJP).

c:simple-property.name: max-post-size
c:simple-property.description: Maximum size in bytes of a POST request that can be parsed by the container. The default value is 2097152.

c:simple-property.name: max-save-post-size
c:simple-property.description: Maximum size in bytes of a POST request that will be saved during certain authentication schemes. The default value is 4096.

c:simple-property.name: name
c:simple-property.description: A unique name for the connector.

c:simple-property.name: protocol
c:simple-property.description: The web connector protocol. (e.g. 'HTTP/1.1' or 'AJP' or a name of a class implementing ProtocolHandler and MBeanRegistration )

c:simple-property.name: proxy-name
c:simple-property.description: The host name that will be used when sending a redirect. The default value is null.

c:simple-property.name: proxy-port
c:simple-property.description: The port that will be used when sending a redirect.

c:simple-property.name: redirect-port:expr
c:simple-property.description: The port for redirection to a secure connector. The default value is 8433.

c:simple-property.name: secure
c:simple-property.description: Indicates if content sent or received by the connector is secured from the user perspective. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: virtual-server
c:simple-property.description: The list of virtual servers that can be accessed through this connector. The default is to allow all virtual servers.

c:simple-property.name: ca-certificate-file
c:simple-property.description: Certificate authority.

c:simple-property.name: ca-certificate-password
c:simple-property.description: Certificate password.

c:simple-property.name: ca-revocation-url
c:simple-property.description: Certificate authority revocation list.

c:simple-property.name: certificate-file
c:simple-property.description: Server certificate file. If the value is not given, ~/.keystore is the default

c:simple-property.name: certificate-key-file
c:simple-property.description: Key file for the certificate.

c:simple-property.name: cipher-suite
c:simple-property.description: The allowed cipher suite.

c:simple-property.name: key-alias
c:simple-property.description: The key alias.

c:simple-property.name: keystore-type
c:simple-property.description: Type of the keystore, There are various types of keystores available, including 'PKCS12' and Sun's 'JKS.'

c:simple-property.name: name
c:simple-property.description: The configuration name.

c:simple-property.name: protocol
c:simple-property.description: The SSL protocols that are enabled.

c:simple-property.name: session-cache-size
c:simple-property.description: SSL session cache.

c:simple-property.name: session-timeout
c:simple-property.description: SSL session cache timeout.

c:simple-property.name: truststore-type
c:simple-property.description: Type of the truststore, There are various types of keystores available, including 'PKCS12' and Sun's 'JKS.'

c:simple-property.name: verify-client
c:simple-property.description: Enable client certificate verification.

c:simple-property.name: verify-depth
c:simple-property.description: Limit certificate nesting.

c:list-property.name: alias
c:list-property.description: The virtual server aliases

c:simple-property.name: default-web-module
c:simple-property.description: The web module deployment name that will be mapped as the root webapp.

c:simple-property.name: enable-welcome-root
c:simple-property.description: Whether or not the bundled welcome directory is used as the root web context. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: name
c:simple-property.description: A unique virtual host name

c:group.name: child:sso=configuration
c:group.displayName: The SSO configuration for this virtual server.

c:simple-property.name: cache-container
c:simple-property.description: Enables clustered SSO using the specified clustered cache container.

c:simple-property.name: cache-name
c:simple-property.description: Name of the cache to use in the cache container.

c:simple-property.name: domain
c:simple-property.description: The cookie domain that will be used.

c:simple-property.name: reauthenticate
c:simple-property.description: Enables reauthentication with the realm when using SSO.

service.name: Rewrite Rules (Profile)
service.description: A list of rewrite rules that will be processed in order on the URL or vhost specified in the request. Those follow the rules for mod_rewrite. Please consult the manual for help on settings

c:simple-property.name: flags
c:simple-property.description: Option flags for this rewrite rule. Consult the mod_rewrite docs.

c:simple-property.name: pattern
c:simple-property.description: The pattern that will be matched. Consult the mod_rewrite docs.

c:simple-property.name: substitution
c:simple-property.description: The string that will replace the original URL or vhost. Consult the mod_rewrite docs.

c:simple-property.name: flags
c:simple-property.description: Option flags for this condition. Consult the mod_rewrite docs.

c:simple-property.name: pattern
c:simple-property.description: The pattern to match. Consult the mod_rewrite docs.

c:simple-property.name: test
c:simple-property.description: Test pattern for the condition. Consult the mod_rewrite docs.

service.name: Access Log (Profile)
service.description: The access log configuration for this virtual server.

c:simple-property.name: extended
c:simple-property.description: Enable extended pattern, with more options. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: pattern
c:simple-property.description: The access log pattern. The default value is common.

c:simple-property.name: prefix
c:simple-property.description: Prefix for the log file name. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: resolve-hosts
c:simple-property.description: Host resolution. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: rotate
c:simple-property.description: Rotate the access log every day. The default value is true.

c:group.name: child:directory=configuration
c:group.displayName: The location for the access logging.

c:simple-property.name: path
c:simple-property.description: The relative folder path.

c:simple-property.name: relative-to
c:simple-property.description: The folder the path is relative to. The default value is jboss.server.log.dir.

service.name: JCA (Profile)
service.description: The Java EE Connector Architecture (JCA) subsystem providing general configuration for resource adapters

c:simple-property.name: enabled:1
c:simple-property.description: Specify whether bean validation is enabled. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: enabled:2
c:simple-property.description: Specify whether archive validation is enabled. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: fail-on-error
c:simple-property.description: Should an archive validation error report fail the deployment. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: fail-on-warn
c:simple-property.description: Should an archive validation warning report fail the deployment. The default value is false.

c:group.name: child:cached-connection-manager=cached-connection-manager
c:group.displayName: Cached connection manager for resource adapters.

c:simple-property.name: debug
c:simple-property.description: Enable/disable debug information logging. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: error
c:simple-property.description: Enable/disable error information logging. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: install
c:simple-property.description: Enable/disable the cached connection manager valve and interceptor. The default value is false.

service.name: BootstrapContext (Profile)
service.description: Bootstrap context for resource adapters.

c:simple-property.name: name
c:simple-property.description: The name of the BootstrapContext

c:simple-property.name: workmanager
c:simple-property.description: The WorkManager instance for the BootstrapContext

service.name: Workmanager (Profile)
service.description: WorkManager for resource adapters.

c:simple-property.name: name
c:simple-property.description: The name of the WorkManager

service.name: Long Running Thread Pool (Profile)
service.description: Long running thread pool executor with a bounded queue where threads submitting tasks may block.

service.name: Short Running Thread Pool (Profile)
service.description: Short running thread pool executor with a bounded queue where threads submitting tasks may block.

service.name: Osgi (Profile)
service.description: The OSGi subsystem configuration.

c:simple-property.name: activation
c:simple-property.description: Activation flag for the OSGi subsystem. Possible values: lazy, eager. The default value is LAZY.

c:simple-property.name: startlevel
c:simple-property.description: The current Start Level of the OSGi Framework. Changing this value will change the Start Level of the Framework accordingly.

service.name: Capability (Profile)
service.description: A framework capability. A capability maps to a JBoss Module in the modules directory or an OSGi bundle in the bundles directory. The identity maps to the resource identifier of the module or bundle.

c:simple-property.name: startlevel
c:simple-property.description: The startlevel for the capability. Can only be specified for OSGi bundles.

service.name: Resource Adapters (Profile)
service.description: Configuration of the resource adapters subsystem.

service.name: Resource Adapter (Profile)
service.description: The configuration of a resource adapter.

c:simple-property.name: archive
c:simple-property.description: Specifies the resource adapter archive

c:simple-property.name: beanvalidationgroups
c:simple-property.description: Specifies the bean validation groups that should be used

c:simple-property.name: bootstrapcontext
c:simple-property.description: Specifies the unique name of the bootstrap context that should be used

c:simple-property.name: transaction-support
c:simple-property.description: Specifies the transaction support level of the resource adapter

service.name: Admin Objects (Profile)
service.description: Specifies the administration objects.

c:simple-property.name: class-name
c:simple-property.description: Specifies the fully qualified class name of a managed connection factory or admin object

c:simple-property.name: enabled
c:simple-property.description: Specifies if the resource adapter should be enabled. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: jndi-name
c:simple-property.description: Specifies the JNDI name for the connection factory or admin object

c:simple-property.name: use-java-context
c:simple-property.description: Setting this to false will bind the object into global JNDI. The default value is true.

service.name: Connection Definitions (Profile)
service.description: Specifies the connection definitions.

c:simple-property.name: allocation-retry:expr
c:simple-property.description: The allocation retry element indicates the number of times that allocating a connection should be tried before throwing an exception

c:simple-property.name: allocation-retry-wait-millis:expr
c:simple-property.description: The allocation retry wait millis element specifies the amount of time, in milliseconds, to wait between retrying to allocate a connection

c:simple-property.name: background-validation
c:simple-property.description: An element to specify that connections should be validated on a background thread versus being validated prior to use. Changing this value requires a server restart. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: background-validation-millis:expr
c:simple-property.description: The background-validation-millis element specifies the amount of time, in milliseconds, that background validation will run. Changing this value requires a server restart

c:simple-property.name: blocking-timeout-wait-millis:expr
c:simple-property.description: The blocking-timeout-millis element specifies the maximum time, in milliseconds, to block while waiting for a connection before throwing an exception. Note that this blocks only while waiting for locking a connection, and will never throw an exception if creating a new connection takes an inordinately long time

c:simple-property.name: class-name
c:simple-property.description: Specifies the fully qualified class name of a managed connection factory or admin object

c:simple-property.name: enabled
c:simple-property.description: Specifies if the resource adapter should be enabled. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: flush-strategy
c:simple-property.description: Specifies how the pool should be flush in case of an error.

c:simple-property.name: idle-timeout-minutes:expr
c:simple-property.description: The idle-timeout-minutes elements specifies the maximum time, in minutes, a connection may be idle before being closed. The actual maximum time depends also on the IdleRemover scan time, which is half of the smallest idle-timeout-minutes value of any pool. Changing this value requires a server restart.

c:simple-property.name: interleaving
c:simple-property.description: An element to enable interleaving for XA connections. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: jndi-name
c:simple-property.description: Specifies the JNDI name for the connection factory or admin object

c:simple-property.name: max-pool-size:expr
c:simple-property.description: The max-pool-size element specifies the maximum number of connections for a pool. No more connections will be created in each sub-pool. The default value is 20.

c:simple-property.name: min-pool-size:expr
c:simple-property.description: The min-pool-size element specifies the minimum number of connections for a pool. The default value is 0.

c:simple-property.name: no-recovery
c:simple-property.description: Specifies if the connection pool should be excluded from recovery

c:simple-property.name: no-tx-separate-pool
c:simple-property.description: Oracle does not like XA connections getting used both inside and outside a JTA transaction. To workaround the problem you can create separate sub-pools for the different contexts. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: pad-xid
c:simple-property.description: Should the Xid be padded. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: pool-prefill
c:simple-property.description: Should the pool be prefilled. Changing this value requires a server restart. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: pool-use-strict-min
c:simple-property.description: Specifies if the min-pool-size should be considered strictly. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: recovery-password
c:simple-property.description: The password used for recovery

c:simple-property.name: recovery-plugin-class-name
c:simple-property.description: The fully qualified class name of the recovery plugin implementation

c:map-property.name: recovery-plugin-properties
c:map-property.description: The properties for the recovery plugin

c:simple-property.name: recovery-security-domain
c:simple-property.description: The security domain used for recovery

c:simple-property.name: recovery-username
c:simple-property.description: The user name used for recovery

c:simple-property.name: same-rm-override
c:simple-property.description: The is-same-rm-override element allows one to unconditionally set whether the javax.transaction.xa.XAResource.isSameRM(XAResource) returns true or false

c:simple-property.name: security-application
c:simple-property.description: Indicates that app supplied parameters (such as from getConnection(user, pw)) are used to distinguish connections in the pool

c:simple-property.name: security-domain
c:simple-property.description: Specifies the security domain which defines the javax.security.auth.Subject that are used to distinguish connections in the pool

c:simple-property.name: security-domain-and-application
c:simple-property.description: Indicates that either app supplied parameters (such as from getConnection(user, pw)) or Subject (from security domain) are used to distinguish connections in the pool

c:simple-property.name: use-ccm
c:simple-property.description: Enable the use of a cached connection manager. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: use-fast-fail
c:simple-property.description: Whether to fail a connection allocation on the first try if it is invalid (true) or keep trying until the pool is exhausted of all potential connections (false). The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: use-java-context
c:simple-property.description: Setting this to false will bind the object into global JNDI. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: use-try-lock:expr
c:simple-property.description: Any configured timeout for internal locks on the resource adapter objects in seconds

c:simple-property.name: wrap-xa-resource
c:simple-property.description: Should the XAResource instances be wrapped in a org.jboss.tm.XAResourceWrapper instance. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: xa-resource-timeout:expr
c:simple-property.description: The value is passed to XAResource.setTransactionTimeout(), in seconds. Default is zero

service.name: EJB3 (Profile)
service.description: The configuration of the ejb3 subsystem.

c:simple-property.name: default-clustered-sfsb-cache
c:simple-property.description: Name of the default stateful bean cache, which will be applicable to all clustered stateful EJBs, unless overridden at the deployment or bean level

c:simple-property.name: default-entity-bean-instance-pool
c:simple-property.description: Name of the default entity bean instance pool, which will be applicable to all entity beans, unless overridden at the deployment or bean level

c:simple-property.name: default-entity-bean-optimistic-locking
c:simple-property.description: If set to true entity beans will use optimistic locking by default

c:simple-property.name: default-mdb-instance-pool
c:simple-property.description: Name of the default MDB instance pool, which will be applicable to all MDBs, unless overridden at the deployment or bean level

c:simple-property.name: default-resource-adapter-name
c:simple-property.description: Name of the default resource adapter name that will be used by MDBs, unless overridden at the deployment or bean level. The default value is hornetq-ra.

c:simple-property.name: default-sfsb-cache
c:simple-property.description: Name of the default stateful bean cache, which will be applicable to all stateful EJBs, unless overridden at the deployment or bean level

c:simple-property.name: default-singleton-bean-access-timeout:expr
c:simple-property.description: The default access timeout for singleton beans. The default value is 5000.

c:simple-property.name: default-slsb-instance-pool
c:simple-property.description: Name of the default stateless bean instance pool, which will be applicable to all stateless EJBs, unless overridden at the deployment or bean level

c:simple-property.name: default-stateful-bean-access-timeout:expr
c:simple-property.description: The default access timeout for stateful beans. The default value is 5000.

c:simple-property.name: in-vm-remote-interface-invocation-pass-by-value
c:simple-property.description: If set to false, the parameters to invocations on remote interface of an EJB, will be passed by reference. Else, the parameters will be passed by value. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: enable-statistics
c:simple-property.description: If set to true, enable the collection of invocation statistics.

service.name: EJB3 Thread Pool (Profile)
service.description: A thread pool executor with an unbounded queue. Such a thread pool has a core size and a queue with no upper bound. When a task is submitted, if the number of running threads is less than the core size, a new thread is created. Otherwise, the task is placed in queue. If too many tasks are allowed to be submitted to this type of executor, an out of memory condition may occur.

c:map-property.name: keepalive-time
c:map-property.description: Used to specify the amount of time that pool threads should be kept running when idle; if not specified, threads will run until the executor is shut down.

c:simple-property.name: time
c:simple-property.description: The time

c:simple-property.name: unit
c:simple-property.description: The time unit

c:simple-property.name: max-threads:expr
c:simple-property.description: The maximum thread pool size.

c:simple-property.name: name
c:simple-property.description: The name of the thread pool.

c:simple-property.name: thread-factory
c:simple-property.description: Specifies the name of a specific thread factory to use to create worker threads. If not defined an appropriate default thread factory will be used.

service.name: File Passivation Store (Profile)
service.description: A file system based passivation store.

c:simple-property.name: idle-timeout:expr
c:simple-property.description: The timeout in units specified by idle-timeout-unit, after which a bean will passivate. The default value is 300.

c:simple-property.name: idle-timeout-unit
c:simple-property.description: The unit of idle-timeout. The default value is SECONDS.

c:simple-property.name: max-size:expr
c:simple-property.description: The maximum number of beans this cache should store before forcing old beans to passivate. The default value is 10000.

service.name: Strict Max Bean Instance Pool (Profile)
service.description: A bean instance pool with a strict upper limit

c:simple-property.name: max-pool-size:expr
c:simple-property.description: The maximum number of bean instances that the pool can hold at a given point in time. The default value is 20.

c:simple-property.name: timeout:expr
c:simple-property.description: The maximum amount of time to wait for a bean instance to be available from the pool. The default value is 5.

c:simple-property.name: timeout-unit
c:simple-property.description: The instance acquisition timeout unit. The default value is MINUTES.

service.name: SFSB Cache (Profile)
service.description: A SFSB cache.

c:list-property.name: aliases
c:list-property.description: The aliases by which this cache may also be referenced

c:simple-property.name: passivation-store
c:simple-property.description: The passivation store used by this cache

service.name: Cluster Passivation Store (Profile)

c:simple-property.name: bean-cache
c:simple-property.description: The name of the cache used to store bean instances.

c:simple-property.name: cache-container
c:simple-property.description: The name of the cache container used for the bean and client-mappings caches. The default value is ejb.

c:simple-property.name: client-mappings-cache
c:simple-property.description: The name of the cache used to store client-mappings of the EJB remoting connector's socket-bindings. The default value is remote-connector-client-mappings.

c:simple-property.name: idle-timeout:expr
c:simple-property.description: The timeout in units specified by idle-timeout-unit, after which a bean will passivate. The default value is 300.

c:simple-property.name: idle-timeout-unit
c:simple-property.description: The unit of idle-timeout. The default value is SECONDS.

c:simple-property.name: max-size:expr
c:simple-property.description: The maximum number of beans this cache should store before forcing old beans to passivate. The default value is 10000.

c:simple-property.name: passivate-events-on-replicate
c:simple-property.description: Indicates whether replication should trigger passivation events on the bean. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: use-qualified-name

service.name: Remote Service (Profile)

c:simple-property.description: The name of the connector on which the EJB3 remoting channel is registered

c:simple-property.description: The name of the thread pool that handles remote invocations

service.name: Channel Creation Options (Profile)
service.description: The options that will be used during the EJB remote channel creation

c:simple-property.description: The type of the channel creation option

service.description: The EJB timer service

c:simple-property.name: path
c:simple-property.description: The directory to store persistent timer information in

c:simple-property.description: The relative path that is used to resolve the timer data store location

c:simple-property.name: thread-pool-name

service.name: ThreadFactory (Profile)
service.description: A thread factory (implementing java.util.concurrent.ThreadFactory).

c:simple-property.name: group-name
c:simple-property.description: Specifies the name of a thread group to create for this thread factory.

c:simple-property.name: name
c:simple-property.description: The name of the created thread factory.

c:simple-property.name: priority:expr
c:simple-property.description: May be used to specify the thread priority of created threads. The default value is -1.

c:simple-property.name: thread-name-pattern
c:simple-property.description: The template used to create names for threads. The following patterns may be used: %% - emit a percent sign %t - emit the per-factory thread sequence number %g - emit the global thread sequence number %f - emit the factory sequence number %i - emit the thread ID.

service.name: ThreadPool (Profile)
service.description: A thread pool executor

service.name: Security (Profile)
service.description: The configuration of the security subsystem.

c:simple-property.name: deep-copy-subject-mode
c:simple-property.description: Sets the copy mode of subjects done by the security managers to be deep copies that makes copies of the subject principals and credentials if they are cloneable. It should be set to true if subject include mutable content that can be corrupted when multiple threads have the same identity and cache flushes/logout clearing the subject in one thread results in subject references affecting other threads. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: cache-type
c:simple-property.description: Adds a cache to speed up authentication checks. Allowed values are 'default' to use simple map as the cache and 'infinispan' to use an Infinispan cache.

c:simple-property.name: code
c:simple-property.description: Class name of the module to be instantiated.

c:simple-property.name: code
c:simple-property.description: Class name of the module to be instantiated.

c:simple-property.name: cipher-suites
c:simple-property.description: Comma separated list of cipher suites to enable on SSLSockets.

c:simple-property.name: client-alias
c:simple-property.description: Preferred alias to use when the KeyManager chooses the client alias.

c:simple-property.name: client-auth
c:simple-property.description: Boolean attribute to indicate if client's certificates should also be authenticated on the server side.

c:simple-property.name: algorithm
c:simple-property.description: Algorithm to use when creating the KeyManagerFactory.

c:simple-property.name: provider
c:simple-property.description: Provider class name to use when creating the KeyManagerFactory.

c:simple-property.name: password
c:simple-property.description: Sets the password of the keystore. Either this or 'truststore-password' must be present otherwise the security domain will be useless.

c:simple-property.name: type
c:simple-property.description: Type of the keystore. If not set, type defaults to 'JKS'.

c:simple-property.name: url
c:simple-property.description: URL of the keystore.

c:simple-property.name: provider
c:simple-property.description: Provider class name to use when creating the KeyStore.

c:simple-property.name: provider-argument
c:simple-property.description: String argument to pass to the keystore Provider constructor when instantiating it.

c:simple-property.name: protocols
c:simple-property.description: Comma separated list of protocols to enable on SSLSockets.

c:simple-property.name: server-alias
c:simple-property.description: Preferred alias to use when the KeyManager chooses the server alias.

c:simple-property.name: service-auth-token
c:simple-property.description: Token to retrieve PrivateKeys from the KeyStore.

c:simple-property.name: algorithm
c:simple-property.description: Algorithm to use when creating the TrustManagerFactory.

c:simple-property.name: provider
c:simple-property.description: Provider class name to use when creating the TrustManagerFactory.

c:simple-property.name: password
c:simple-property.description: Sets the password of the truststore. Either this or 'keystore-password' must be present otherwise the security domain will be useless.

c:simple-property.name: type
c:simple-property.description: Type of the truststore. If not set, type defaults to 'JKS'.

c:simple-property.name: url
c:simple-property.description: URL of the truststore.

c:simple-property.name: provider
c:simple-property.description: Provider class name to use when creating the truststore.

c:simple-property.name: provider-argument
c:simple-property.description: String argument to pass to the truststore Provider constructor when instantiating it.

c:simple-property.name: code
c:simple-property.description: Class name of the module to be instantiated.

c:simple-property.name: type
c:simple-property.description: Type of mapping this module performs. Allowed values are principal, role, attribute or credential..

c:simple-property.name: code
c:simple-property.description: Class name of the module to be instantiated.

c:simple-property.name: type
c:simple-property.description: Type of mapping this module performs. Allowed values are principal, role, attribute or credential..

c:simple-property.name: code
c:simple-property.description: Fully Qualified Name of the Security Vault Implementation.

service.name: Messaging (Profile)
service.description: The messaging subsystems

service.name: HornetQ (Profile)
service.description: The HornetQ based messaging subsystem

c:simple-property.name: allow-failback
c:simple-property.description: Whether this server will automatically shutdown if the original live server comes back up. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: async-connection-execution-enabled
c:simple-property.description: Whether incoming packets on the server should be handed off to a thread from the thread pool for processing. False if they should be handled on the remoting thread. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: backup
c:simple-property.description: Whether this server is a backup server. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: cluster-password
c:simple-property.description: The password used by cluster connections to communicate between the clustered nodes. The default value is CHANGE ME!!.

c:simple-property.name: cluster-user
c:simple-property.description: The user used by cluster connections to communicate between the clustered nodes. The default value is HORNETQ.CLUSTER.ADMIN.USER.

c:simple-property.name: clustered
c:simple-property.description: Whether the server is clustered. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: connection-ttl-override
c:simple-property.description: If set, this will override how long (in ms) to keep a connection alive without receiving a ping. The default value is -1.

c:simple-property.name: create-bindings-dir
c:simple-property.description: Whether the server should create the bindings directory on start up. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: create-journal-dir
c:simple-property.description: Whether the server should create the journal directory on start up. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: failback-delay
c:simple-property.description: How long to wait before failback occurs on live server restart. The default value is 5000.

c:simple-property.name: failover-on-shutdown
c:simple-property.description: Whether this backup server (if it is a backup server) should come live on a normal server shutdown. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: id-cache-size
c:simple-property.description: The size of the cache for pre-creating message IDs. The default value is 2000.

c:simple-property.name: jmx-domain
c:simple-property.description: The JMX domain used to register internal HornetQ MBeans in the MBeanServer. The default value is org.hornetq.

c:simple-property.name: jmx-management-enabled
c:simple-property.description: Whether HornetQ should expose its internal management API via JMX. This is not recommended, as accessing these MBeans can lead to inconsistent configuration. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: journal-buffer-size
c:simple-property.description: The size of the internal buffer on the journal.

c:simple-property.name: journal-buffer-timeout
c:simple-property.description: The timeout (in nanoseconds) used to flush internal buffers on the journal.

c:simple-property.name: journal-compact-min-files
c:simple-property.description: The minimal number of journal data files before we can start compacting. The default value is 10.

c:simple-property.name: journal-compact-percentage
c:simple-property.description: The percentage of live data on which we consider compacting the journal. The default value is 30.

c:simple-property.name: journal-file-size
c:simple-property.description: The size (in bytes) of each journal file. The default value is 10485760.

c:simple-property.name: journal-max-io
c:simple-property.description: The maximum number of write requests that can be in the AIO queue at any one time.

c:simple-property.name: journal-min-files
c:simple-property.description: How many journal files to pre-create. The default value is 2.

c:simple-property.name: journal-sync-non-transactional
c:simple-property.description: Whether to wait for non transaction data to be synced to the journal before returning a response to the client. The default value is true.

c:simple-property.name: journal-sync-transactional

c:simple-property.name: redelivery-delay
c:simple-property.description: Defines how long to wait before attempting redelivery of a cancelled message. The default value is 0.

c:simple-property.name: redistribution-delay
c:simple-property.description: Defines how long to wait when the last consumer is closed on a queue before redistributing any messages. The default value is -1.

c:simple-property.name: send-to-dla-on-no-route
c:simple-property.description: If this parameter is set to true for that address, if the message is not routed to any queues it will instead be sent to the dead letter address (DLA) for that address, if it exists. The default value is false.

c:simple-property.name: timeout
c:simple-property.description: How long to wait for a handling decision to be made; an exception will be thrown during the send if this timeout is reached, ensuring that strict ordering is kept. The default value is 5000.

c:simple-property.name: type
c:simple-property.description: Whether the handler is the single 'Local' handler for the cluster, which makes handling decisions, or a 'Remote' handler which converses with the local handler.

service.description: A runtime-only resource representing a HornetQ address. Zero or more queues can be bound to a single address. When a message is routed, it is routed to the set of queues bound to the message's address.

c:list-property.name: queue-names

c:simple-property.description: The name of a security role.

c:simple-property.description: This permission allows the user to consume a message from a queue bound to matching addresses.

c:simple-property.description: This permission allows the user to create a durable queue.
